result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Defendant Nicolaus Cordell Sharp in court, in custody.  
Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Nicolaus Cordell Sharp.  
Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Status Conference. 
Defendant  has a pending  matter before the court, which has been adjourned. This case to follow.   
Court ordered matter adjourned for a Status on 11-14-2022 at 9:00am.

Defendant Nicolaus Cordell Sharp in court, in custody.  
Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Nicolaus Cordell Sharp.  
Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Plea and Sentencing. 
Defendant has a pending felony matter that is in trial posture. This case to follow as a status.   
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

HELD OFF RECORD WITH APPROVAL OF JUDGE KIES. 

Off record discussions held. Due to court congestion and availability case is adjourned.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse. Parties notified.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Nicolaus Cordell Sharp not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties requesting a plea and sentencing date.   Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Reduction.  (Nicolaus C. Sharp - #2022001534, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (9 pages) commencing 04-27-22 by AMY DE LA ROSA.

Defendant Nicolaus Cordell Sharp in court by video with Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask who appears in person.  Defendant Nicolaus Cordell Sharp in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer R. Carthen. Court took judicial notice of 21CF2819. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court via zoom, defendant Nicolaus Cordell Sharp not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Parties before the court for defense bail hearing.  Arguments heard.  Court GRANTED defense motion and ordered bail reduced to $1000. cash with Turn Over To Justice Point for Level 5 supervision.  Conditions of bail include Attending all court dates and no further violations of the law rising to the level of probable cause.    Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing.  mn
Case is adjourned to 4/19/22 at 8:30 for Bail/Bond hearing in Br 45.  Parties notified.   mn

Defendant Nicolaus Cordell Sharp in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Nicolaus Cordell Sharp in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a preliminary hearing. State's witness is present. Due to court congestion, Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility. Defense request to be heard as to bail.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Nicolaus Cordell Sharp not in court, defendant in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Nicolaus Cordell Sharp not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Robert Hampton to be appointed pending a conflict check. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with S.A.O.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Nicolaus Cordell Sharp in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Nicolaus Cordell Sharp in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nicolaus Cordell Sharp appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.   Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 1. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
